initialize_persona.description: Initializes the database paths for the given persona.

manual_sync_instructions.description:
Triggers a manual synchronization of the AI's core instruction files.
SECURITY: This is a restricted tool.

rebuild_manifests.description: Rebuilds specified manifest JSON files using the central config.

search_dnd_rules.description: Performs a web search using Google's Custom Search API.

browse_website.description: Reads the text content of a single webpage.

list_project_files.description: Lists all files and directories within the project.

read_file.description: Reads the contents of a specific file within the project.

execute_sql_read.description:
(Pillar 1) Executes a read-only SQL query (SELECT) against the database.
Returns results as a JSON string.

execute_sql_write.description:
Executes a write query (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE) on the database using a
tiered security model.

execute_sql_ddl.description:
(Pillar 2) Executes a Data Definition Language (DDL) query against the database.
This is a high-level, protected tool restricted to the Primary Operator.

execute_vdb_read.description: Queries the vector database for similar documents. Can be filtered by metadata (`where`) or a specific list of `ids`.

execute_vdb_write.description:
Manages the vector database using a tiered security model.
- 'add': Low-level access, anyone can use.
- 'update': Medium-level, restricted to the data's owner or the Primary Operator.
- 'delete': High-level, restricted to the Primary Operator only.

parameters.name: metadatas
parameters.type: typing.Optional[typing.List[typing.Mapping[str, typing.Union[str, int, float, bool, chromadb.base_types.SparseVector, NoneType]]]]

execute_write.description:
(HIGH-LEVEL ORCHESTRATOR) Automates a synchronized write to both SQLite and the Vector DB.
It relies on the low-level tools for all execution and security checks.

create_git_commit_proposal.description:
(Pillar 3 & 4 Unified) Creates a new Git branch, writes content to a file,
commits the change, and pushes the branch to the remote 'origin'.
